data.title: Nobel Lecture Series: Elfriede Jelinek
data.meta_description: Elfriede Jelinek was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2004. She is an Austrian playwright and novelist. The musical flow of voices and counter-voices in her novels and plays reveal the absurdity of society clichés and their subjugating power. Presented by Beverly Weber, Professor of German., powered by Localist Event Calendar Software
data.text: Elfriede Jelinek was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2004. She is an Austrian playwright and novelist. The musical flow of voices and counter-voices in her novels and plays reveal the absurdity of society clichés and their subjugating power. Presented by Beverly Weber, Professor of German.
